snippet: Under pressure to do more to confront the Ebola outbreak sweeping across West Africa, President Obama is expanding military and medical resources to combat the spread of the deadly virus.
abstract: President Obama, under pressure to do more to confront the Ebola outbreak sweeping across West Africa, will announce expansion of military and medical resources to combat spread of the deadly virus; will offer to help Liberia in construction of as many as 17 Ebola treatment centers in region.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER, MICHAEL D. SHEAR and DENISE GRADY
byline.contributor: Denise Grady contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Under pressure to do more to confront the Ebola outbreak sweeping across West Africa, President Obama is expanding military and medical resources to combat the spread of the deadly virus.

headline.main: U.S. to Commit Up to 3,000 Troops to Fight Ebola in Africa
headline.print_headline: Obama to Call for Expansion of Ebola Fight

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
